abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact is substantial. Some aspects that emerged
            from this project deserve special mention, in particular the
            careful selection of an appropriate consultant, who was not
            only skilled in drafting legislation, in presenting new
            organizational structures, and defining staff positions, but
            in addition to the technical skills, was also capable to
            communicate, and persuade for acceptance of new concepts.
            Restructuring issues suggest flexibility in the content of
            the terms of reference (TOR), phasing and sequencing of
            actions and decisions, and for the time frame needed to
            implement Government agreements, and actions; however, most
            importantly, restructuring of institutions requires a
            different type of consulting concept - process consulting -
            which is a way to manage change. This entails a
            consultant's ability to structure the relationship with
            the client, such that the help provided is genuinely
            relevant to the client's needs. In Georgia, problems in
            government organizations are so complex, and the information
            relevant to their diagnosis is so concealed, that meaningful
            changes can only be achieved if the client is fully involved
            in the diagnosis, and study processes. And, while the
            implementation of the restructuring of the Ministry of
            Transport and Communications had to overcome many obstacles,
            it nevertheless met less resistance than would a reform
            designed to overhaul the entire governmental structure.
